div.p:
Your letter, dated 6 April, was yesterday placed before a meeting of the Trustees of the Royal Park, and I am directed to express the regard of our colleagues, that your remoteness from Melbourne
SM: Lyall lived in a property just east of Melbourne I think which is now an historic home but I can't remember the name.
Anthing to add from minutes. continues to interfere with your attendance at our meetings, and that you thus have resolved to resign. Should this be your final decision, then the Trustees think your communication would need to be direct to the hon. the President of the Board of Land and Works, by whon we all vere appointed.Trusting that you still may be able to share actively in our labors I remain
